function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Ambiguity in the definition of 'natural spaces' and 'biophilic design' may lead to inconsistent interpretation and implementation.","Impact":"Inconsistent implementation of biophilic design can result in ineffective disease mitigation strategies and compromised public health.","Mitigation":"Standardize the terminology and criteria for biophilic design to ensure consistent interpretation and application across different projects.","Technologies":"Standardization frameworks and guidelines, digital tools for design evaluation and verification.","People":"Architects, designers, public health officials, building occupants.","Owner":"Architectural organizations, public health agencies, building owners and developers."},{"Description":"Lack of clarity in taxonomies of 'nature' in the frameworks may result in misinterpretation and inappropriate application of biophilic design principles.","Impact":"Misinterpretation and inappropriate application of biophilic design can lead to suboptimal building designs and compromised public health outcomes.","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive reviews and revisions of the taxonomies to ensure accurate and explicit descriptions of 'nature' in architecture.","Technologies":"Data analytics and visualization tools, stakeholder engagement platforms for feedback and input.","People":"Architects, designers, researchers, building occupants.","Owner":"Architectural organizations, research institutions, building owners and developers."},{"Description":"Differences in interpretations and frameworks may lead to conflicting design approaches and criteria for biophilic design in practice.","Impact":"Conflicting design approaches and criteria can cause confusion and inconsistency in the application of biophilic design, potentially leading to suboptimal building environments for public health.","Mitigation":"Facilitate interdisciplinary collaboration and dialogue to reconcile differences and align key principles and criteria across the frameworks.","Technologies":"Remote collaboration and communication tools, project management platforms for interdisciplinary coordination.","People":"Architects, designers, public health officials, building occupants.","Owner":"Architectural organizations, public health agencies, building owners and developers."}]}
